column5: Well its been a while since i posted here with some pictures i managed to go out in the kirkland lake area 2 weeks ago for a weekend getway but turned out to be 8 days lol caught fish everyday released alot kept a few for the dinner table no big fish this time up anyways here was my rides for the 8 days    a few fish that came home for dinner    me holding a few     some scenery        i did see a couple moose but the camera was forgotten somewhere but i did see this nice bald eagle who sat around for a solid hour watching me fish not the best picture but ok   and what the weather looked like when i got home back in windsor    all i have to say the storm was pretty intense  but a couple days later i bought myself this for a very good price    and the last of it smoked speckle trout   hope you's enjoyed ill be heading back up that way again in august good fishing and play safe
Now that is where I would like to spend next years Canada Day!!!Sounds like the fishing was awesome and the scenery is amazing. Thanks for sharing.
Wish I could have hooked up with you Rene, next time for sure! Nice pic's, some of them are pretty familiar  , and congrat's on the new boat!
Great pictures! The tornadoish one and Bald Eagle one are rare sights, cool that you got photos. Thanks for posting, ehg
my band had a gig in kirkland lake in feb,  man it was like minus 60 i swear!
That's a cool tornado pic.  Did it touch down?  Nice report, love the scenery shots.  That Close Encounters rock is pretty cool.  Joey
Nice report & scenery pics !!!!!gotta love the taste of those northern walleyes too....cheers
Great report and pic's, nice looking boat...

Wow...cool funnel clouds!!  You said not many fish, but with scenery like that I'd feel pretty great just fishing in that setting.  I hope to experience that soon!!!  Great report and pics...thanks for taking the time to post!!
No actually the bigger funnel sucked up the little one beside it it was pretty neat   thanks all for the replys
